data.title: Earnings Snapshot: Warner Bros. Discovery Q4 streaming revenue, subscribers top estimates
Nuveen Churchill Direct Lending GAAP NII of $0.44 beats by $0.02, TII of $50.04M beats by $0.44M
data.description:
• Nuveen Churchill Direct Lending Corp. press release (NCDL): Q4 GAAP NII of $0.44 beats by $0.02.
  • Total investment income of $50.04M (-12.3% Y/Y) beats by $0.44M.
  • Net asset value ("NAV") per share of $17.72, compared to $17.85 per share as of September 30, 2025.
  • Declares first quarter distribution of $0.40 per share, consisting of a regular distribution of $0.36 per share and a supplemental distribution of $0.04 per share
  • Board authorized a $50 million share repurchase program

data.title: Rhythm Pharmaceuticals GAAP EPS of -$0.73 beats by $0.07, revenue of $57.3M beats by $1.09M
data.description:
• Rhythm Pharmaceuticals press release (RYTM): Q4 GAAP EPS of -$0.73 beats by $0.07.
  • Revenue of $57.3M (+37.0% Y/Y) beats by $1.09M.

Guidance December 31, 2026

  • Rhythm anticipates approximately $385 million to $415 million in Non-GAAP operating expenses.
  • Non-GAAP operating expenses are derived from GAAP total operating expenses, inclusive of SG&A expenses of approximately $197 million to $213 million.
  • R&D expenses of approximately $188 million to $202 million.
  • Excluding stock-based compensation.

data.title: Ligand Pharmaceuticals Non-GAAP EPS of $2.02 beats by $0.52, revenue of $59.7M beats by $4.11M
data.description:
• Ligand Pharmaceuticals press release (LGND): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $2.02 beats by $0.52.
  • Revenue of $59.7M (+39.5% Y/Y) beats by $4.11M.

2026 Financial Guidance

  • Ligand is reaffirming its 2026 financial guidance introduced at the company's Investor Day on December 9, 2025. The Company continues to expect adjusted earnings per diluted share1 of approximately $8.00 to $9.00.
  • Ligand also expects 2026 royalty revenue to be in the range of $200 million to $225 million, revenue from sales of Captisol to be in the range of $35 million to $40 million and contract revenue to be in the range of $10 million to $20 million, resulting in total revenue of $245 million to $285 million.

data.title: Krispy Kreme rallies as turnaround efforts start to pay off
data.description:
Krispy Kreme (DNUT) reported revenue fell 2.9% year over year to $392.4M in Q4, with organic revenue declining 3.9%, largely due to the strategic closure of underperforming doors that reduced global points of access by 13.5%. 

Adjusted net income improved sharply to $15.0M, with adjusted EPS of $0.09 vs. $0.04 consensus and $0.01 a year ago. Adjusted EBITDA rose 21% to $55.6M, helped by productivity initiatives, SG&A savings, removal of McDonald's USA-related costs, and $4.8M of business interruption insurance recoveries tied to the 2024 cyber incident. Notably, the company generated $45.0M of operating cash flow and $27.9M of free cash flow in the quarter.

In the U.S. segment, revenue fell 6.1% to $230.2 million as closures drove a 5.8% organic revenue decline, but APD increased 4.5% year over year and 7.0% sequentially to $660, reflecting the pruning of low-volume, unprofitable doors. International revenue grew 2.9% to $142.5M, driven by Japan and Mexico despite POA reductions in those markets. 

CEO Josh Charlesworth highlighted the meaningful progress made on the company's turnaround, emphasizing strong consumer demand, profitable U.S. expansion, and capital-light international franchise growth. He noted that exiting underperforming U.S. doors modestly pressured revenue but materially lifted EBITDA margin. "In 2026, we look forward to building on this momentum through systemwide sales growth, additional refranchising activity, disciplined capital expenditures, lower net leverage, and positive free cash flow generation," he stated.

Looking ahead, Krispy Kreme (DNUT) plans to open at least 100 shops globally. FY26 system-wide sales growth of 2% to 4% is anticipated.

Shares of Krispy Kreme (DNUT) rallied 12.4% in premarket action to $3.36 vs. the 52-week range of $2.50 to $6.51. Short interest on DNUT stands at 12.8% of the total float.

data.title: Nexstar MediaEPS of -$5.63, revenue of $1.29B beats by $40M
data.description:
• Nexstar Media press release (NXST): Q4 EPS of -$5.63 may not be comparable to consensus of $3.55.
  • Revenue of $1.29B (-13.4% Y/Y) beats by $40M.
  • Fourth quarter net revenue of $1.29 billion, declined $199 million year-over-year, or (13.4%), primarily due to lower political advertising revenue related to the election cycle.
  • Fourth quarter distribution revenue of $720 million, increased $6 million, or 0.8%, versus the comparable prior year quarter, primarily reflecting increased rates, growth in vMVPD subscribers, and the addition of CW affiliations on certain of our stations, offset, in part, by MVPD subscriber attrition.
  • We are providing guidance for Nexstar on a standalone basis for full year 2026 Adjusted EBITDA in a range of $1.95 billion to $2.05 billion. Key factors differing from our current expectations could affect our outlook for Adjusted EBITDA for 2026 either positively or negatively.

data.title: Hagerty Non-GAAP EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.05, revenue of $357.33M beats by $33.4M
data.description:
• Hagerty press release (HGTY): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.05.
  • Revenue of $357.33M (+18.5% Y/Y) beats by $33.4M.
  • Fourth quarter 2025 Total Revenue increased 19% year-over-year to $357 million, and full year 2025 Total Revenue increased 17% year-over-year to $1,456 million
  • Fourth quarter 2025 Written Premium increased 19% year-over-year to $259 million, and full year 2025 Written Premium increased 14% year-over-year to $1,194 million
  • Fourth quarter 2025 Commission and fee revenue increased 18% year-over-year to $106 million, and full year 2025 Commission and fee revenue increased 15% year-over-year to $486 million
    • Policies in Force Retention was 88.7% as of December 31, 2025 compared to 89.0% in the prior year period, and total insured vehicles increased 9% year-over-year to 2.8 million
  • Fourth quarter 2025 Earned Premium increased 14% year-over-year to $193 million, and full year 2025 Earned Premium increased 13% year-over-year to $727 million
  • Fourth quarter 2025 Marketplace revenue increased 80% year-over-year to $29 million, and full year 2025 Marketplace revenue increased 119% year-over-year to $119 million
  • For full year 2026, Hagerty anticipates:
    • Written Premium growth of 15% to 16%
    • Total Revenue change of (12)% to (11)%, as Markel related commission revenue is eliminated under the new fronting arrangement1
    • Net Income of $(51) million to $(41) million, including ~$190 million of pre-tax Markel fronting arrangement transition costs2
    • Adjusted EBITDA of $236 million to $247 million

data.title: Nordic American Tankers GAAP EPS of $0.06, revenue of $21.16M
data.description:
• Nordic American Tankers press release (NAT): Q4 GAAP EPS of $0.06.
  • Revenue of $21.16M (+141.6% Y/Y).
  • The fourth quarter of 2025 produced a Net profit of $11.7 million, compared to the third quarter with a net loss of -$2.8 million.
  • The adjusted EBITDA for the fourth quarter came in at $34.7 million (non-GAAP measure), an improvement of $13.3 million from the third quarter with $21.4 million adjusted EBITDA.
  • The average time charter equivalent (TCE) for our fleet during the fourth quarter of 2025 came in at $35,000 per day per vessel versus $27,490 per day per ship in the third quarter of 2025. These numbers are on a discharge-to-discharge basis.
